De Montfort’s death left Glouoester without a rival, and much tempted him to take the lead on the popular side. He does not seem to have aided at the siege ol' Kenilworth; and though one of those elected to sit as an arbitrator upon the terms of the Bau, in October 1266, he disapproved of, and opposed them. Early in that year William de Braose, Canon of Llandaff, was elected Bishop; and Griffith a Rhys, taken prisoner, was committed to Cardiff casile, and thence, 1n 1267, sent to Kilkenny for greater security.
